executive_summary: The role of medical group practice management providers in healthcare settings has expanded in recent years. An accelerating shift away from independent healthcare providers toward group settings has been the main driver behind the industry's growth, while an evolving regulatory environment, an aging population and cost pressures have also encouraged healthcare providers' decision to outsource. Outsourcing aspects of management help healthcare providers maintain compliance, improve efficiency and manage costs while upholding quality patient care.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An aging population's expanding medical needs boost healthcare spending
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising incomes, broader access to public and private insurance programs and the aging population's growing medical needs have supported rising healthcare expenditure in recent years. Adults 65 and older have the highest prevalence of chronic conditions, leading this demographic to be the largest spenders on healthcare services. Expanding healthcare spending has facilitated the transition to larger group medical practices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Financial Pressures Drive the Shift in Healthcare Delivery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Traditional healthcare delivery models transform as physicians face mounting financial and operational pressures. Independent practitioners used to be the status quo, but physicians are increasingly opting for the group practice model.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19'S DISRUPTION TO THE HEALTH SECTOR BENEFITS MEDICAL GROUP PRACTICE MANAGEMENT PROVIDERS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Healthcare providers continue to feel the unprecedented strain of the pandemic on their infrastructure, labor, expenses and delivery models.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: EXPANSION OF TECHNOLOGICAL ADOPTION ENHANCES EFFICIENCY OF SERVICES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Tech adoption is critical for healthcare providers, particularly as the medical industry adopts to a post-COVID world and more emphasis is placed on providing convenience to a broad array of patients.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SHIFTS TOWARD THE GROUP MODEL AND OUTSOURCING WILL STRENGTHEN MANAGEMENT PROVIDERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Medical group practice management companies will have a mounting role as healthcare providers continue confronting the pandemic's strain on their infrastructure, labor and balance sheets.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AN EVOLVING HEALTHCARE LANDSCAPE INTRODUCES NEW EXPECTATIONS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Healthcare delivery has been shifting over the past decade, with the pandemic accelerating how providers meet and connect with patients.
Ongoing shifts to value-based care will place higher emphasis on meeting regulatory standards and maintaining compliance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Group Practice Management Providers Will Balance The Rewards and Risks of an Aging Population
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Medical group practice management providers will be vital in managing the burden of an aging population's increasingly complex health needs.

industry_definition: This industry comprises medical groups of physicians of various disciplines, including primary care physicians and specialist doctors.

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: Financial pressures are accelerating the shift from the independent practice to the group setting.
Healthcare providers have turned to management providers as a solution to staffing shortages.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Patients 65 and older have the highest healthcare consumption.
Patients aged 45 to 64 experience rising medical needs.
Patients aged 25 to 44 have lower healthcare consumption.
Children and young adults have a lower prevalence of chronic conditions.

products_and_services.product_description: Other key specialties include obstetrics, cardiology, anesthesiology.
Family practice physicians treat chronic conditions.

tier_1_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Laboratory Supply Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Medical Instrument & Supply Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Primary Care Doctors in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Financial Pressures Incentivize Family Practice Providers
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Independents merge with medical group practice management providers.

business_locations.location_description: A central population hub with high healthcare utilization.

regulations_points.regulation_title: HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT

basis_points.basis_title: Patients see value in multifaceted healthcare delivery
basis_points.basis_description: Providers incentivize patients by offering a range of care.

FAQs.question: Has increased access to health insurance offered opportunities for your company?
FAQs.answer: Expanded access to health insurance has led to increased demand for healthcare.
